page.title: 17RELIGION IN STAMBOURNE 2
page.content: The Congregational chapel was founded in 1662 and is well endowed. The present building was erected in the 1960's. The former manse stands next door. This is now a private house. The church has a semi-retired pastor who lives in the village. One service is held every Sunday; he takes some, and others are conducted by lay preachers. The regular congregation numbers about 25. The famous Victorian preacher,C.H. Spurgeon, was brought up in Stambourne by his grandfather, who was pastor of the chapel between 1810 & 1864. Some residents of Stambourne travel to nearby towns, eg Haverhill, to attend churches of other denominations eg Methodist, Roman Catholic. But church and chapel both have adherents who have belonged to other denominations but now worship in the village where they live.
